meanings.definition: To make something appear old or ancient.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys archaizing her furniture to give it a vintage look.
meanings.sent2: The artist was archaizing the painting to make it seem like a relic from the past.
meanings.sent3: By archaizing her costume, she transformed into a character from a historical play.
meanings.sent4: The antique shop owner was archaizing the new items to attract customers looking for old-fashioned decor.
meanings.sent5: The magician's spell seemed to archaize the room, transporting everyone back in time.

meanings.definition: To imitate or mimic the style of an earlier time period.
meanings.sent1: The museum curator was archaizing the exhibit to recreate the atmosphere of the 1920s.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer was archaizing the latest collection to reflect the trends of the Victorian era.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to archaize the menu by offering traditional dishes from ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent4: The movie director's choice of black and white film was a clever way to archaize the movie.
meanings.sent5: The theater production used elaborate costumes to archaize the Shakespearean era for the audience.
